property.name: text
property.value: A single robot target localization example that uses the State Space mechanism. For the previous mechanism that does not require state space models ( TargetDynamics and MeasurementModels), please see: In this model, the behavior of the particle filter is given by the two state space actors it is associated with.

property.name: text
property.value: TargetDynamics defines the state space model of the target, which defines the state to be estimated by the particle filter. The state corresponds to the x-y coordinates of the targets for this example in 2D space.

property.name: text
property.value: This actor describes the range measurement, also associated with the particle filter state estimator. Any output port of this model will appear as an input port to an associated estimator actor.

property.name: legend
property.value: particles, search robot position, target position, estimated target position

entity.name: Gaussian
entity.doc: Create a sequence of gaussian random variables
